item.title: macOS command-line tools you might not know about
item.description: - The macOS command-line tools mentioned in this post provide unique functionalities that can be useful for various tasks.

item.title: The Password Game
item.description: - The post is about choosing a password, which is an important aspect of online security.

item.title: Outlook now ignores Windows' Default Browser & opens links in Edge by default
item.description: - Microsoft Outlook now opens browser links in Microsoft Edge by default for users with Microsoft 365 Personal or Family subscriptions.

item.title: FedEx Accused of Largest Odometer Rollback Fraud in History with Used Vans
item.description: - FedEx is being accused of engaging in the largest odometer rollback fraud in history by replacing odometers on used vans and selling them with inaccurate mileage.

item.title: The hidden cost of air quality monitoring
item.description: - Some air quality monitor manufacturers are increasing hidden costs for customers, such as expensive proprietary sensor modules and lock-in to their ecosystem.

item.title: The Deep Sea (2019)
item.description: - The post explores the fascinating world of the deep sea, including the different species and adaptations that allow them to survive in such extreme environments.

item.title: Is ORM still an anti-pattern?
item.description: - ORMs (Object-Relational Mapping) are an abstraction that helps software developers interact with databases more easily.

item.title: Build your own Docker with Linux namespaces, cgroups, & chroot
item.description: - Docker is a popular containerization platform that uses Linux namespaces, cgroups, and chroot to provide isolation, resource management, and security for applications.

item.title: LLM Powered Autonomous Agents
item.description: - LLM (large language model) can serve as the core controller of autonomous agents, allowing them to perform complex tasks and problem-solving.

item.description: - Hugging Face CEO Clement Delangue testified before the U.S.
